page.title: 06A LONGSTANTON HOUSEWIFE
page.content:
I rise early, usually at about six. After getting my husband and daughter off to work I see to my own breakfast, then wash up and do some housework. By eleven I am ready to go out and I may do some shopping then; by twelve I must be at school, where I am a lunch_ time supervisor. I enjoy this, though it is no easy job.
Part of the afternoon is my leisure time. I may spend it in the garden, or with a book or the television; or I may get on with more housework. Then I must get ready for my family's return. I like to have their meal ready, and to hear about their day. After that I may see more television, or I may be busy on household jobs till bed-time, which is often at about 10 o'clock.
